Context.Title: Does this affect me?
Content: Your role will remain the same in terms of providing the best quality hear and treat care for patients. However, NRLS will be able to alert you to patients who have had NRLS data such as care plans created for them. NRLS be able to provide pointers to detailed patient information such as care plans which will help clinicians to provide more accurate and timely hear and treat care.

Context.Title: Does this affect my patients?
Content: Yes, this should have a positive impact on our patients as it will allow you as the Ambulance Service clinician to be able to provide hear and treat care with greater knowledge of the patient and their requirements.

Context.Title: How does it work?
Content: This capability of the NRLS  will enable ambulance services to view the information that participating Mental Health Trusts have agreed to share, such as the patient care plans.
This index can be queried through the NRLS which would be accessible through your electronic system.
The result is that patient care plans can be viewed to enable direct care, helping support the delivery of treatment to patients in a more timely manner.

Name: Paramedic

Context.Title: Does this affect me?
Content: Where possible you will have access to patient care plans or the specific contact details of how to obtain care plan information. This information will be available through either your portable tablet device or MDT and will enable you to provide more accurate and timely care to the patient.

Context.Title: Does this affect my patients?
Content: Patients with care plans made available will be able to receive treatment which is specific to them and so receive more appropriate care which is specific to the details of their care plan. This could include information such as how to spot signs of when a patient may become distressed and what to do in the event of crisis.

Context.Title: How does it work?
Content: For phase 1 of NRLS, when a mental health professional saves a care plan on their computer,  a bookmark of the care plan will be saved on to the NRLS. This will allow Ambulance Services to know that a care plan exists for that patient and where it exists.
Later phases of the NRLS will enable ambulance services to access actual care plan information through viewing a copy of the care plan or being given contact details to the care plan owner.

BenefitsTitle: As a Paramedic, NRLS will benefit me by

Context.Title: Does this affect me?
Content: NRLS will be able to alert you to patients who have had NRLS data such as care plans created for them, which will be shown in the form of a 'flag'. NRLS will, where affected, be able to provide pointers to detailed patient information such as care plans which will help dispatchers  provide more accurate and timely patient information when requested by the paramedic team.

Context.Title: Does this affect my patients?
Content: Yes, this should have a positive impact on our patients as it will allow you as the Ambulance Service Dispatcher to be able to quickly relay critical patient information to the paramedics where necessary.

Context.Title: How does it work?
Content: This capability of the NRLS  will enable ambulance services to view the information that participating Mental Health Trusts have agreed to share, such as the patient care plans.
This index can be queried through the NRLS which would be accessible through your electronic system.
The result is the patient care plan can be viewed to enable direct care. This is informed care and will help and support the delivery of care and treatment to patients in a more timely manner.

Name: Counsellor

Context.Title: Does this affect me?
Content: As a Care Co-ordinator your role will not change as a result of the NRLS. You will create care plans as usual for the patients you are co-ordinating care.

Context.Title: Does this affect my patients?
Content: The NRLS will be able to locate these care plans as your Trust has agreed to develop a pointer identification system for the care plan and share these pointers with the NRLS. The NRLS can index the information from that pointer as specific information about the plan, namely what type of plan and where the plan exists.

Context.Title: How does it work?
Content: This capability will enable services such as the 999, 111 and ambulance services to view the information that your Trust has greed to share. This index can be queried through the NRLS which would be accessible through their electronic system.
The result is your care plan can be viewed to enable direct care. This is informed care and will help and support the delivery of care and treatment to your patient in a more timely manner.

BenefitsTitle: As a Mental Health Clinician, NRLS will benefit me by
